column2: Although we have lived in separate settlements in these isles, there has been a great deal of interchange between our peoples. It should be said that though we came with the sword, we have given the Saxons much in the way of culture, and now they seek to emulate us.
Let them, this will only cement our hold on the land!

Around our lands more people are using a Norse-influenced dialect, ensuring our continued dominance. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of a stronger realm.
My vassal has spent much time amongst the people and has come to represent a new kind of Anglo-Saxon
It is impossible to remain apart from the Anglo-Saxons, but we will always look North.
Canute is still a great name!
